Transformation of true parameter values

transform_parm.Rd

Function that transforms parm based on scale.

transform_parm(parm = parm, scale = scale)

Arguments

parm

A named list of true parameter values:

  • alpha: The fixed coefficient vector of length P_f.

  • C: The number (greater or equal 1) of latent classes of decision makers. If P_r = 0, then C is ignored.

  • s: The vector of class weights of length C.

  • b: The matrix of class means as columns of dimension P_r x C.

  • Omega: The matrix of class covariance matrices as columns of dimension P_r*P_r x C.

  • Sigma: The error term covariance matrix of dimension J x J. Internally, Sigma gets differenced with respect to alternative J, so it becomes a covariance matrix of dimension J-1 x J-1.
scale

A list of three elements, determining the parameter normalization with respect to the scale of utility:

  • parameter: either "a" (for a linear coefficient of "alpha") or "s" (for a variance of the error-term covariance matrix "Sigma")

  • index: the index of the parameter that gets fixed

  • value: the value for the fixed parameter

Value

The transformed version of parm

Examples

parm = check_parm(parm = NULL, P_f = 2, P_r = 2, J = 3)

#> Error in rdirichlet(rep(1, parm$C)): object '_RprobitB_rdirichlet' not found
scale = check_scale(scale = NULL, P_f = 2, J = 3)
transform_parm(parm = parm, scale = scale)

#> Error in transform_parm(parm = parm, scale = scale): object 'parm' not found
